wikipedia_page.main: General The Hon. Sir St. George Gerald Foley  (10 July 1814 – 24 January 1897) was a British Army officer who became Lieutenant Governor of Guernsey.

response: *188n–?: (2nd Battalion] Gen. Hon. Sir St George Gerald Foley, KCB

He was succeeded by his son, the fourth Baron. He was also a Whig politician and succeeded his father as Captain of the Honourable Corps of Gentlemen-at-Arms in 1833, a post he held until 1834, and again from 1835 to 1841, from 1846 to 1852, from 1852 to 1858, from 1859 to 1866 and from 1868 to 1869. On the death of his second son, the sixth Baron, in 1918, this line of the family failed. The late Baron was succeeded by his first cousin once removed, the seventh Baron. He was the grandson of General the Hon. Sir St George Gerald Foley, third son of the third Baron.  the title is held by the seventh Baron's grandson, the ninth Baron. He succeeded his father, a composer and pianist who held the title for 83 years, in 2012.
| ||1874|| Lt-Gen. Hon. St George Gerald Foley

response: *Lieutenant-General and Honorary General the Honourable St George Gerald Foley, C.B.
Foley was born in Westminster, the son of General The Hon. Sir St George Gerald Foley, who was, among other things, Lieutenant Governor of Guernsey from 1874 to 1879.
*St George Gerald Foley (1814–1897), British Army general
